RaiderIOParser module

class RaiderIOParser.RaiderIOParser(client: RaiderIOApiConnector)[source]

Bases: Parser

Parse(url: str, query: str)[source]

This functions sends a request to the RaiderIOApiConnector

Parameters:

  • url – full URL of the request

  • query – This is what we want to request from RaiderIO

Returns:

It returns the response from the RaiderIO API for the query we gave it

ParseAffix(region: str, locale: str)[source]

This is the function where we parse the weekly affix data from the RaiderIOApiConnector.RequestAffix

Parameters:

  • region – the region whose affixes you want from

  • locale – the language in which you want them returned for full list https://raider.io/api

Returns:

a pandas series containing the data obtained from RaiderConnect.RequestAffix

ParseChar(region: str, realm: str, character: str, field: str = None) → Series[source]

This is the function where we parse the character details data from the RaiderIOApiConnector.RequestCharacter

Parameters:

  • region – the region the character is from

  • realm – the realm the character is from

  • character – the character’s name

  • field – here you add extra attributes you can request from raider.io about a character. If you want to add

multiple extra fields you need to seperate them using a comma, for example ‘gear,talents,mythic_plus_ranks’ See https://raider.io/api for the full list of available fields :return: a pandas series containing the information obtained from a RaiderIOApiConnector.RequestCharacter

ParseMythicRun(season, run_id: str)[source]

This is the function where we parse a singular mythic dungeon run data from the RaiderIOApiConnector.RequestMythicRun

Parameters:

  • season – name of the season to retrieve (season-dataframe-1, etc.). Defaults to current season.

  • run_id – ID of the run that you want to get details for

Returns:

a pandas series containing the data obtained from RaiderConnect.RequestMythicRun

client = None
